citation.article-title: Psychroflexus torquis gen. nov., sp. nov., a psychrophilic species from Antarctic sea ice, and reclassification of Flavobacterium gondwanense (Dobson et al. 1993) as Psychroflexus gondwanense gen. nov., comb. nov.

p.s: Psychroflexus (Psy.chro'flex.us. Gr. adj. psychros cold; L. masc. n. flexus bend, curve; M. L. masc. n. Psychroflexus cold bend)
Cellular morphology ranges from rodlike cells to coiled filaments and filaments of indeterminate length.
Coccoid cells are present in older cultures.
Ring-shaped cells and gas vesicles are not formed.
Either non-motile or motile via slow gliding motility.
Major cellular fatty acids are a15:0, a15:10Ï‰10c, i16:0, 3-OH i16:0 and 3-OH a17:0.
Major respiratory quinone is menaquinone-6 (determined for Psychroflexus gondwanense only).
G + C content 32-36 mol % (determined by thermal denaturation).
Genus contains two species, Psychroflexus gondwanense and Psychroflexus torquis.
